oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Estimating sitatunga density using time in front of the camera
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Megan Brownlee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sitatunga is a spiral-horned antelope endemic to wetlands in sub-Saharan Africa. To date, there are no published scientific estimates of sitatunga density. We used camera trap data of sitatunga sightings from 2015-2018 to estimate density using a novel method called time in front of the camera (TIFC) developed by Nakashima et al. (2018).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Earth and Environmental Sciences
Other
